title: Fairfax Media appoints new editors at The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age
text:
Fairfax Media appoints new editors at The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age Megan Levy twitter TWEET More 
Fairfax Media on Monday announced several changes to senior editorial leadership positions across The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age . 
Darren Goodsir informed staff on Monday morning that he had resigned as Editor-in-Chief of The Sydney Morning Herald, after 3Â½ years in the position and almost 20 years with Fairfax Media. SHARE Darren Goodsir has resigned as Editor-in-Chief of the Sydney Morning Herald. Photo: Peter Rae 
The announcement came as three new appointments were made within the newspapers' senior ranks. 
James Chessell has been appointed Fairfax Media's National Editor, with responsibility for federal politics, business and world coverage across The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age; Lisa Davies has been appointed Editor of The Sydney Morning Herald and Alex Lavelle has been appointed Editor of The Age . SHARE Link Lisa Davies, new editor of The Sydney Morning Herald, and Alex Lavelle, new editor of The Age. 
Sean Aylmer, Fairfax Media's Editorial Director, said Chessell, Davies and Lavelle were accomplished journalists who would become the most senior editorial voices at the mastheads. 
"Their appointments underline our commitment to producing quality journalism to inform and enrich the communities we serve," he said. Advertisement 
"They are all outstanding journalists, skilled editors and passionate about journalism that packs a punch. Quality, agenda-setting journalism is what The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age are all about and will continue to deliver. 
"Together, these editors ensure continued strength of the unique editorial voices of The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age . They will deliver on the needs of their Sydney and Melbourne local audiences, and work collaboratively to deliver outstanding and unrivalled national coverage." SHARE Link James Chessell has been appointed Fairfax Media's National Editor. 
Aylmer praised the editorial leadership of Goodsir, who he said had guided the newsroom through significant change in recent years and been instrumental in driving digital growth. 
"Darren's an incredibly talented journalist. He's more than made his mark during his outstanding 32 years in journalism," Aylmer said. SHARE Link Fairfax Media has announced several new senior editorial appointments. 
"That The Sydney Morning Herald reigns supreme as the nation's No.1 masthead across all platforms is a credit to Darren's outstanding editorial leadership of an incredibly talented team. 
"We wish Darren all the very best as he takes some time to enjoy life beyond the media industry." 
Chessell is presently The Australian Financial Review 's European Correspondent, and previously its Business Editor. In 2014 he won a Walkley Award for business journalism, and the previous year a Citi Journalism Award for Excellence 
"James is the ideal candidate to further develop our mastheads' agenda-setting business and national affairs coverage," Aylmer said. 
"He is one of Australia's best business journalists with extensive international experience and has an insider's knowledge of the political landscape." 
Davies has held several senior reporting and editing roles at The Sydney Morning Herald , most recently as Deputy Editor, Investigations Editor and Justice Editor. 
"Lisa is an outstanding journalist with excellent news judgement," Aylmer said. 
"She brings a depth of experience to running the newsroom and has demonstrated impressive leadership skills over the past 12 months." 
Lavelle took on the highest editorial position at The Age on an acting basis in December 2016. Earlier that year, he had taken on senior editorial duties at The Age , where he was worked since 1999 in several roles including Deputy News Director and Sports Editor. 
"Alex has done an outstanding job during the past two months leading The Age newsroom, and in his prior roles, demonstrating his journalistic and management capabilities," Aylmer said. 
Chessell, Davies and Lavelle will report to Aylmer. Advertisement
